wikipedia_page.main: Robert Haslam, Baron Haslam (4 February 1923 in Bolton, Lancashire – 2 November 2002 in Virginia Water, Surrey), was a British industrialist and chairman of British Steel Corporation and British Coal. He was created a Life Peer in 1990.

response: * Sir Robert Scholey (1921–2014), Bob Scholey, known as 'Black Bob', deputy chairman and chief executive of British Steel (1976–1986), Chairman of British Steel (1986–1992), succeeding Sir Robert Haslam
* Robert Haslam (Pony Express) (1840–1912), Pony Express rider
* Robert Haslam (industrialist) (1923–2002), chairman of British Coal and British Steel
* Sir Robert Haslam, Chairman, British Coal Corporation.
* Robert Haslam (Pony Express) (1840–1912), Pony Express rider in the American Old West
* Robert Haslam, Chairman, British Steel Corporation, Chairman, Tate & Lyle plc.
